raw_text:
Blinx sequel purrs nicely
 
 The original Blinx was intended to convert many platform game lovers to Microsoft's then new Xbox console.
 
 Its sharp graphics and novel gameplay, with the main character able to pause, slow, rewind and fast-forward time, were meant to lure many fans to the new machine. But poor design meant the game became a very frustrating affair with players often stranded half-way through a level without the required tools to finish. Thankfully, the sequel has fixed many of the original faults. This time around you do not play as Blinx but instead you are given the chance to create two unique cat characters and two pig characters.
 
 The character generator is very detailed and a few minutes of tweaking and adjusting will create a unique personality to unleash on the game.
 
 As the game progresses you swap between the two rival factions, pig and feline, assuming the role of your created characters. The thrust of the game sees the two factions competing to recover pieces of a missing Time Crystal. As in the original, your feline persona can control time, but this time the pigs get to control space. There are a number of puzzles which require control over time to solve while the pigs can create things such as warps, space bubbles and void traps in order to progress. The control over space and time is achieved through a number of VCR-style icons and is quite intuitive.
 
 Annoyingly, the puzzles are a little too obviously flagged up and most gamers will find it more of a chore than a challenge to solve them. The game has also tried to emulate franchises such as Jak and Daxter and Ratchet and Clank on PS2 and so there are a number of combat elements. These are a little predictable and tend to drag the general polish of the game down to a more dulled affair. But the game's excellent graphics, easily the best-looking platform game around, sound and dollops of humour make it an attractive game for younger platform fans.
 
 Blinx 2 is out on Xbox now.
llama3.2:1b: The Blinx sequel was intended to convert many console gamers to Microsoft's Xbox console.
The original game had sharp graphics but poor design made it frustrating for players who wanted to finish levels without tools.
The sequel corrects these issues and allows players to create two unique cat and pig characters, with the character generator being detailed enough to create a unique personality.
Players switch between two rival factions, pigs and cats, as they compete to recover pieces of a missing Time Crystal by using time control and space manipulation abilities.
However, puzzles are overly obvious and can be found challenging rather than exciting.
llama3.2:3b: The sequel to Blinx has improved upon its predecessor by addressing poor design issues, offering a character generator with detailed options, and introducing rival factions with unique abilities.
The gameplay still requires players to switch between controlling time and space, but puzzles are too easily identifiable and combat elements feel predictable, affecting the game's overall polish.
gemma2:2b: Blinx 2 has improved upon the original with a new character creation system, two factions (cats and pigs) competing to retrieve a Time Crystal, unique puzzles requiring time or space manipulation, and combat elements inspired by other franchises.
The game features strong graphics and sound but also includes some predictable combat sequences that detract from its overall polish.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Blinx 2 is a sequel to the original Blinx, which was intended to convert many platform game lovers to Microsoft's Xbox console.
However, some of the design flaws in the original led to it becoming a frustrating game with players often stranded halfway through levels without tools or knowledge to finish them.
The new sequel has been updated with character generation and gameplay mechanics that are more suitable for younger platform fans.
qwen2.5:1.5b: The sequel to Blinx features unique cat and pig characters, improved gameplay mechanics, enhanced character customization with detailed personality options, competitive time-crystal recovery between two factions, space-time control via VCR icons, simplified puzzles but poor combat elements, high-quality graphics and sound, making it an enjoyable platform game for fans of the original.
qwen2.5:3b: Blinx sequel improves upon original by offering character creation and multiplayer space-time puzzles.
Graphics are top-notch but gameplay is repetitive with predictable combat elements.
Puzzles can be too obvious, yet the engaging visuals, sound, humor, and intuitive control over time/spaces make it attractive for younger platform fans on Xbox.

deepseek-r1:1.5b: Binx 2 is an updated version of the Blinx game with two cat and pig characters that switch factions to add challenge.
The sequel allows players to control time with felines and space with pigs, solving puzzles using VCR icons.
graphics are top-notch and polished on PS2.
While it's mature due to space/time mechanics, it's the best platform game of its kind.
tinyllama:1.1b: Purrs nice sequel for Blinx: The original game intended for the Microsoft Xbox console was a fun adventure with unique gameplay and graphics, but poor design meant players often struggled to finish levels due to missing tools or time restrictions.
Thankfully, Blinx 2 fixes many of these issues by allowing players to create two unique cat characters and two different pig characters.
The game's main character is no longer Blinx, instead players choose their created characters as well as playing as a random piг character.
The game's puzzles rely on VCR-style icons for control over space and time and are easy to solve, but combat elements can sometimes feel predictable.
Despite its shortcomings, the game's graphics, sound, and humorous comedy make it an attractive option for younger platform fans.
Blinx 2 is now available on Xbox.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Blinx sequel brings back its original charm while refining elements that led to its initial success with players transitioning from their favorite platform games.
The new version has a character generator with detailed character creation options, allowing users to create unique characters while playing as the pig or feline factions.
The game introduces a new puzzle mechanic with VCR-style icons, making it more intuitive for players to navigate through levels.
However, this can lead to frustration if not done optimally, with many gamers struggling to find solutions that are less obvious than the original.
The combat elements may be enjoyable for some fans of the series but detract from the overall polish and appeal of the game when compared to its predecessor.
Despite these shortcomings, Blinx sequel remains a fun and engaging platformer for younger platform fans.
With the release of the new Xbox on June 28th, it offers an opportunity to relive the classic experience or introduce it to a broader audience.
phi:2.7b: Blinx 2 is a platformer video game that allows players to create their own feline or pig character and compete with them in collecting pieces of a Time Crystal.
It features puzzles, combat, and the ability to control both time and space through icons on VCR-style devices.
While some elements may be predictable, the game's graphics and humor make it enjoyable for younger gamers.
orca-mini:3b: The original Blinx was created to convert many platform game lovers to Microsoft's new Xbox console.
However, the game had poor design which meant many players became frustrated and couldn't finish it.

But the sequel fixed many of the original faults by allowing players to create two unique cat or pig characters and giving them the chance to play as their created characters in a unique blend of puzzle-solving, combat, and humor.
The game has excellent graphics and sound effects, and adds to its charm with humor and some interesting twists.
Overall, Blinx 2 is an attractive game for younger platform fans.
hermes3:3b: Blix-2 sequel has improved gameplay, allowing creation of cat and pig characters with time/space control for competing factions to retrieve Time Crystal pieces.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Blinx 2, a sequel to the original Blinx, addresses the frustrations of the first game by allowing players to create and switch between two unique characters: cat and pig.
With a detailed character generator, players can customize their creations' personalities.
The game's plot focuses on recovering pieces of a missing Time Crystal, with each character controlling time and space abilities.
While some puzzles are easy to solve, combat elements feel predictable and lessen the overall experience.
Blinx 2 remains an attractive game for younger platform fans due to its excellent graphics, sound, and humor, now available on Xbox.
chatgpt-4o-latest: Blinx 2 improves on its predecessor by fixing frustrating design flaws and introducing new gameplay elements.
Instead of playing as Blinx, players create two unique cat and pig characters, switching between rival factions competing to recover a missing Time Crystal.
Cats control time, while pigs manipulate space, using intuitive VCR-style icons.
While puzzles are often too obvious and combat elements feel predictable, the game boasts excellent graphics, sound, and humor, making it appealing to younger platform fans.
Blinx 2 is now available on Xbox.

Players swap between the two factions controlling time or space, with each faction utilizing VCR-style icons for control.

While some puzzles are too obvious, overall graphics, sound, and humor make Blinx ..
2 an attractive game for younger platform fans on Xbox.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Blinx 2, a sequel to the original, addresses previous issues with frustrating level design by allowing players to create and customize their own cat or pig characters using an intricate character generator.
The game features two rival factions: felines controlling time and pigs manipulating space.

Players alternate between these roles as they progress through levels, solving time-based puzzles with time-manipulation controls and spatial challenges for the pigs, such as creating warps and void traps.
Despite its attractive graphics and humor, Blinx 2 faces criticism for overly flagged puzzles that may seem more like chores than genuine challenges.
The game also incorporates elements reminiscent of PS2 franchises Jak and Daxter and Ratchet and Clank, introducing combat components that can diminish the overall polish.
Nonetheless, Blinx 2's appeal lies in its captivating visuals, immersive audio, and engaging content for younger platform enthusiasts.
